title: Routing Issues: Rogers Canada
body: Three or four days ago my ping suddenly went up in between matches from 28 to 58. It stayed there for the remainder of the day. The following day it went back down one game, up another, down another. It does not fluctuate in game but it seems random as to whether I get put in a game on a 58 ping server or 28 ping server. It's incredibly frustrating...

replies.body:
Hmmm....this honestly seems to be a routing issue with your ISP.  There are times that your ISP sends your connection on a very efficient route, netting you only 28 ping.  Other times it sends you on a more in-efficient route, given you an extra 30 ping.  This is why it can vary fairly drastically game-to-game.  

Unfortunately, since the path is being provided by your ISP, there is very little we can do.  We are peered with Rogers Communication, but it is still up to Rogers to get your connection onto our Direct Network.

I wish there was more that I could do!

I finally had the time to wait around for Rogers support. I just told them about the issue myself and many other Rogers users were experiencing and it was no help. All they tried to do was rope me into some $69.99/mo TechXpert deal. Are you sure Riot is not supposed to be the ones dealing with this? Anyways, it's still happening and it's incredibly frustrating rolling the dice on ping between 28, 41, and 56 ms. If I am to continue playing the game in any sort of competitive manner that just doesn't work at all.

I fixed it with WTFast. Load up a free trial (and pay for it if it works for you) and manually connect to Toronto 4. Toronto 5 also seems okay, but Toronto 4 in my experience has been a bit better.

Your ping will only be 5 ms higher instead of 20-30 ms higher.

EDIT: if you don't live in Ontario you may need to try other servers closer to you.

Thanks for the advice, using Toronto 4 I actually don't experience any less ping than I did before this routing issue came up. It's a shame Riot can't just poke Rogers and say "hey, some stuff is messed up, let's fix this." But maybe I'll just pay for this service.
